titleStmt.title: Joyfull nevves from the Marquesse of Ormond and the Princes army in Ireland concerning their late fight with the Parliamen[t]s forces, and the landing of 3000 horse in Ireland, for Prince Charles, by the Duke of Lorraign; with a resolution to joyn with 7000. Scots under the Lord of Ards. 3000 Irish commanded by the E. of Clanrickard, 7000 of the Spanish faction, commanded by Gen. Oneal, and 13900 of Ormonds forces which escaped the last fight. All which are designed against the Lord Governour Cromwell, whose numbers will amount to above 30000 horse and foot. Also the Scots declaration concerning their declared King, and all those who have broken the covenant, despised the oath of God, corrupted the truth, and subverted the fundamentall government by King and Parliament.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
